chapter.title: Copies
chapter.para: Administration > Copies allows customization of the cataloguing of copies in your library. You can customize the document type, statistical code, section, status, localization, owner, and finally add customizable fields to your copies.

sect1.title: Types of documents
sect1.para: Types of documents allows configuration of the various copy media and for each of them the duration of the loan in days.

Warning, this represents the type of document that will be displayed for the copy and not for the work. It is defined here to supplement or display information details pertaining to the type of document defined for the work. In PMB, the work medium type is normalized in UNIMARC.
The type of document is also used to define the Loan Duration or the Reservation Duration for a copy.

Warning If advanced loans quotas are activated (type pmb parameter, advanced-quotas sub-type set to 1), the columns Loan Duration and Reservation Duration display See quotas. For more information, refer to and .

The two columns Coding owners and Import coding correspond to the management of the information gathered when importing UNIMARC copies to establish a link with the type of document already defined. For more information, refer to the chapter Definitions.

sect1.title: Statistical codes
sect1.para: The statistical code is used for loan statistics and for the media library holdings.

The two columns Coding owners and Import coding correspond to the management of the information gathered when importing UNIMARC copies, to establish a link with the type of document already defined. For more information, refer to the chapter Definitions.

sect1.title: Sections
sect1.para: The section is the part of the media library to which the document belongs to (adult, youth, music ...) This code,for example, is taken into account to calculate BDP statistics.
This sector might correspond to a physical part of the media library as large as a room or as small as a shelf.

The two columns Coding owners and Import coding correspond to the management of the information gathered when importing UNIMARC copies to establish a link with a section already defined. See the chapter for more information.

sect1.title: Status
sect1.para: The notion of status is used to specify if the document can be loaned or not.

The status deals generally with a physical state (damaged, good, lost) or a position on the book path between the acquiring decision by the library and the loan to the reader (ordered, being acquired, being catalogued, being repaired ...).

The two columns Coding owners and Import coding correspond to the management of the information gathered when importing UNIMARC copies to establish a link with a status already defined. For more information, refer to the chapter Definitions.

sect1.title: Localizations
sect1.para: The localization can be used to link the document with a specific location (example: in reserve).

This localization notion is very important for multi-site libraries. It can also be very useful for specialized documentation centers: research laboratory or company, in which the books can be loaned for a long or short duration. These are out of the shelf and can be found in the design department or in the office of a scientist. In this case, PMB can be used to define a localization Design department and a corresponding status Reference work, for which the loan would obviously be impossible because the copy is not on the shelves. This solution allows tracing the books whose presence might be required outside of the library without requiring a loan with an unspecified duration.

The two columns Coding owners and Import coding correspond to the management of the information gathered when importing UNIMARC copies to establish a link with the type of document already defined. For more information, refer to the chapter Definitions.

You can define different parameters for each localization. For example, these parameters could define request letters or the library address. Each time the library address is required, PMB looks for the corresponding value in localization.

sect1.title: Owners
sect1.para: You will find here the copy owners list managed in the catalog. You can mention here a deposit from the Loan Departmental Library , a collection from a gift that you wish to identify ...

sect1.title: Customizable data
sect1.para: These correspond to your own library information about the copies. It allows specification of data from your own management: source of the gift or financing for the acquisition, ...

Example. let's add a field entitled Type of book cover that will enable us to specify le type of binding for a book. Bindings can be of 3 types: soft, hardback, paperback. Not all the copies correspond to books, we could have another choice: Not Applicable.
Click on New field
The following screen is displayed:

For Name of the field, enter cover (do not use accents, spaces or punctuation marks in the name for a field), for Displayed title, enter Cover (you can also use a name with spaces but only for display purposes, for example Type of cover).
For type of entry choose List box. Then click on Options.

figure.title: Options for the List box type

sect1.para: Click on Add 4 times to define 4 different choices: paperback, soft, hardback, Not Applicable. The stored values in the database are paperback, soft, hardback and nocover. You will then get the result displayed above. Then click on Save to close the popup window, and on Save to add your parameter.
You can now use your new customized field for any input or modification of a copy. For more information on the creation of a copy, refer to the PMB User's Guide.
In Cataloguing > work > new bibliographical note, after defining a new note, you can add a copy. You will then see your new customized field.

figure.title: Editing a copy, the customized field Type of cover has been added

sect2.title: Type of inputs for customizable fields
sect2.para: Other than list box, other types of inputs are available for a customizable field.
There are five types of customizable fields:
Each one of these types has 5 different options. Click on Options to specify the parameters for these fields.

sect3.title: Text type
sect3.para: For a text type you can specify its screen size. You can also specify the maximum number of letters to enter (if larger that the specified size on screen, you will still be able to enter even when you reach the end of the input box).

sect3.title: List box type
sect3.para: Warning you cannot create options for the choices until the field has been recorded. From the the screen to add a parameter, record the customizable field. Then click on its name to modify it and specify options.

figure.title: Options for the List box type

sect3.para: For a list box you can specify:

listitem.para: if it is a multiple choice list (to select multiple choices in a list with you internet browser, you need to click on the choices while holding down the control key.)
the default value. When no choice is selected, this value will be the one that will be displayed.

a list of options, This list includes a label: the text that will be displayed on screen; a value: the value that will be stored in PMB (accents, spaces, punctuation ... are not allowed). An order for the various options is specifiable.

sect3.para: With the action buttons you can:

listitem.para: add an extra choice to the list
delete the choices you have checked on the checkbox at the beginning of each corresponding line

sect3.title: List box from a request type

figure.title: Options for a List box from a request type

sect3.para: For a List box from a request you can specify:

listitem.para: if it is a multiple choice list (to select multiple choices in a list with you internet browser, you need to click on the choices while holding down the control key.)
the default value. When no choice is selected, this value will be the one that will be displayed
a request that will display the options list.

sect3.para: With the action buttons you can:

listitem.para: test your request. When you click on this button, the choices are displayed by the request under the button. This will enable you to check the validity of your request,

sect3.title: Date type
sect3.para: There are no particular options for the customizable fields of the type date. Clicking on the Options button will only display the message above.

sect3.title: Comment zone type

figure.title: Options for the Comment zone type

sect3.para: Fields of the type Comment zone work the same way as the text fields. Additionally, you can specify a number of lines for the comment field.

sect2.title: Data types, visible in OPAC, mandatory
sect2.para: Five types of data can be stored in the PMB database: text, large text, integer, date, decimal number.

Visible in OPAC allows to select if this field will be visible by the readers. This way you can add reserved fields for the library personnel: for example, the name of the person who created the note, ...
Mandatory specifies that the field must be filled. If the field is not filled during input or modification of a copy, an error message will be displayed.

figure.title: Warning for an unfilled mandatory field
